meanings.definition: To transmit or broadcast using radio waves.
meanings.sent1: The station radioes news updates every hour.
meanings.sent2: She radioes her music show to listeners around the world.
meanings.sent3: The cat radioes its meows to the neighborhood through the open window.
meanings.sent4: His laughter radioes through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waves radioes a sense of calm to the beachgoers.

meanings.definition: To communicate or send messages using a radio.
meanings.sent1: The team radioes their positions to each other during the game.
meanings.sent2: He radioes for help after getting lost in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel radioes its excitement about finding a nut to its friends.
meanings.sent4: Her smile radioes her happiness to everyone she meets.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh bread radioes a feeling of warmth and comfort in the kitchen.

meanings.definition: To listen to broadcasts on a radio device.
meanings.sent1: Every morning, she radioes the weather forecast before heading out.
meanings.sent2: He radioes the latest sports scores while driving to work.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside radio their cheerful songs into the house.
meanings.sent4: The scent of flowers radioes the arrival of spring in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The clock radioes the time with its gentle ticking in the quiet room.
